Madagascar - Projet d'assistance
            technique etude de la plaine d'Antananarivo

abstracts.cdata!:
This is the project completion report
            (PCR) for the Technical Assistance Project for the Study of
            the Plain of Antananarivo in Madagascar. The objective of
            the project was to prepare an integrated plan for flood
            control and development in the Plain of Antananarivo.
            Specifically: (a) technically coherent and financially
            feasible pre-investment studies were to be conducted at a
            pre-feasibility stage for flood control and expansion of
            economic activities; (b) the network of research stations
            for erosion and soil protection, hydrological measurements
            and flood alerts, was to be improved; and (c) the capability
            of the Directorate General of Planning was to be
            strengthened to supervise the project. This was a successful
            Technical Assistance project. The final master plan for the
            rehabilitation and long-term development was revised to
            minimize investment needs and maximize economic benefits, to
            improve the flood-warning system for the lower town of
            Antananarivo, and for institutional coordination of major
            structures in the plain. The master plan was used as the
            basis for the Antananarivo Plain Development Project which
            was approved on March 29, 1990. It also led to significant
            donor support for other projects on the plain.
